message.content:
After reviewing the table, we need to sum all the amounts recorded under the “Sales Expenses” transactions. (Other Expense types – “Administrative Expenses” and “Financial Expenses” – are not included.) When we add these together step‐by‐step the total sales expenses amount comes out to approximately 668597.96. (The step‐by‐step addition is shown in the “Reasoning” part above.)

Thus, the final “Selling Expenses” item in the income statement (representing the sum of all “Sales Expenses”) is 668597.96.
